tips.title: Proper Lighting:
content: Lighting plays an important role in portrait photography. Use soft, natural light to avoid harsh shadows on the face. If you are indoors, try using a window as a light source.

tips.title: Focus on the Eyes:
content: The eyes are the “window to the soul,” and they should be the main focus when photographing the head. Ensure the eyes are sharply focused to bring life to your portrait.

tips.title: Correct Angle:
content: The angle of shooting can significantly change the perception of the face. Shooting at eye level usually works well, but don't be afraid to experiment. Shooting from above can be flattering, while shooting from below can add drama.

tips.title: Background Choice:
content: The background can greatly affect the overall impression of the photograph. Choose a simple, neutral background to emphasize the face. Avoid cluttered or distracting backgrounds.

tips.title: Facial Expression:
content: A person's facial expression can tell a story. Ask the model to relax and be natural. Try to capture various emotions to create interesting and expressive portraits.
